C Puzzle #2

20 Oct 2012

What is the output of the following script? Why? How can it be fixed to get the expected output?

[c]#define __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS

include <inttypes.h>

include <stdio.h>

int main() { uint64_t testvar;

testvar = 1<<30;
printf("2^30 = %" PRIu64 "\n", testvar);

testvar = 1<<31;
printf("2^31 = %" PRIu64 "\n", testvar);

return 0;

} [/c]

. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Answer

[text]230 = 1073741824 231 = 18446744071562067968[/text]

Expected output

[text]230 = 1073741824 231 = 2147483648[/text]

Explanation

1<<30 does a bitshift for int, not for uint64_t

How to fix it

Add a typecast:

[c]#define __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS

include <inttypes.h>

include <stdio.h>

int main() { uint64_t testvar;

testvar = 1<<30;
printf("2^30 = %" PRIu64 "\n", testvar);

testvar = ((uint64_t) 1)<<31;
printf("2^31 = %" PRIu64 "\n", testvar);

return 0;

} [/c]
